service.title: HTTP State Management Mechanism
service.documentation: This document specifies a way to create a stateful session with Hypertext Transfer Protocol (HTTP) requests and responses. It describes three new headers, Cookie, Cookie2, and Set-Cookie2, which carry state information between participating origin servers and user agents. The method described here differs from Netscape's Cookie proposal [Netscape], but it can interoperate with HTTP/1.0 user agents that use Netscape's method.

http-header.documentation: The origin server initiates a session, if it so desires. To do so, it returns an extra response header to the client, Set-Cookie2.
The Cookie2 request header facilitates interoperation between clients and servers that understand different versions of the cookie specification.
